alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Medina (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 12:18PM EDT until April 01 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT FOR MEDINA AND CUYAHOGA COUNTIES... At 1217 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Cleveland to near Lodi, moving east at 60 mph. Additional thunderstorms are developing ahead of this line across Cuyahoga County. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. Numerous trees were downed in northern Ashland County. Lorain County airport gusted to 61 mph. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Medina, Parma, Lakewood, Euclid, Cleveland Heights, Strongsville, Brunswick, Westlake, North Royalton, Solon, Wadsworth, Warrensville Heights, Rittman, Lodi, Highland Hills, Chippewa Lake, North Olmsted, Garfield Heights and Shaker Heights. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Lorain County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Strong wind gusts in excess of 50 mph will continue even after the rain exits.
